problem: In a coordinate plane, points $P(3,4)$, $Q(3,10)$, and $R(9,4)$ form a triangle. What is the area of $\triangle PQR$?
solution: Since $P$ and $Q$ have the same $x$-coordinate, line $PQ$ is vertical and can serve as the height of the triangle, which is $10 - 4 = 6$ units. The base of the triangle $PR$ has a length of $9 - 3 = 6$ units as $P$ and $R$ share the same $y$-coordinate. The area of $\triangle PQR$ is then $\frac{1}{2} \times 6 \times 6 = \boxed{18}$ square units.
